intro: Trichera nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada trichera, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Nevada. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for desert ecosystems.
